unnormalised: **Environmental News: Renewable Energy Surges in Rajasthan!**
normalised: **Environmental News: Renewable Energy Surges in Rajasthan!**

unnormalised: Namaste folks! Rajasthan, the land of kings, is now aiming to be the king of renewable energy! Dr. Sharma, a leading scientist from IIT-Delhi, recently announced a breakthrough in solar panel efficiency, specifically tailored for the desert climate.
normalised: Namaste folks! Rajasthan, the land of kings, is now aiming to be the king of renewable energy! Doctor Sharma, a leading scientist from I I T-Delhi, recently announced a breakthrough in solar panel efficiency, specifically tailored for the desert climate.

unnormalised: This comes as the state government has sanctioned Rs. 5000 Cr for expanding solar farms near Jodhpur. Think vast, shimmering fields of solar panels as far as the eye can see! We're talking about adding nearly 2000 MW of capacity!
normalised: This comes as the state government has sanctioned rupee five thousand crore for expanding solar farms near Jodhpur. Think vast, shimmering fields of solar panels as far as the eye can see! We're talking about adding nearly two thousand megawatt of capacity!

unnormalised: The project aims to electrify remote villages and reduce reliance on coal-fired power plants. This will definitely improve the air quality, which, let's be honest, gets pretty bad during Diwali time.
normalised: The project aims to electrify remote villages and reduce reliance on coal-fired power plants. This will definitely improve the air quality, which, let's be honest, gets pretty bad during Diwali time.

unnormalised: One innovative pilot project even combines solar power with traditional rainwater harvesting techniques, covering an area of approximately 5000 sq ft! Now that’s what we call jugaad! It also includes 100 km of new power lines. This truly showcases India's commitment to a greener future. So, keep an eye on Rajasthan – they are blazing a trail!
normalised: One innovative pilot project even combines solar power with traditional rainwater harvesting techniques, covering an area of approximately five thousand square feet! Now that’s what we call jugaad! It also includes one hundred kilometer of new power lines. This truly showcases India's commitment to a greener future. So, keep an eye on Rajasthan – they are blazing a trail!
